intro: Stichorkis kempfii, commonly known as the Kempf's stichorkis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
